sections.context:
GE.14- Agreement
Concerning the Adoption of Uniform Technical Prescriptions for Wheeled Vehicles, Equipment and Parts which can be fitted and/or be used on Wheeled Vehicles and the Conditions for Reciprocal Recognition of Approvals Granted on the Basis of these Prescriptions* (Revision 2, including the amendments that entered into force on 16 October 1995) Addendum 47: Regulation No.48 Revision 12 Covering all series including the 06 series of amendments:
Supplement 1 to the 06 series of amendments to the Regulation: Date of entry into force: 15 July 2013 Corrigendum 1 to Supplement 1 to the 06 series of amendments to the Regulation - Date of entry into force:
13 March 2013 Supplement 2 to the 06 series of amendments to the Regulation: Date of entry into force: 3 November 2013 Supplement 3 to the 06 series of amendments to the Regulation: Date of entry into force: 10 June 2014 Supplement 4 to the 06 series of amendments to the Regulation: Date of entry into force: 9 October 2014 Uniform provisions concerning the approval of vehicles with regard to the installation of lighting and light-signalling devices UNITED NATIONS *  Former title of the Agreement: Agreement Concerning the Adoption of Uniform Conditions of Approval and Reciprocal Recognition of Approval for Motor Vehicle Equipment and Parts, done at Geneva on 20 March 1958.
16 October 2014 E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 3
Regulation No.48 Uniform provisions concerning the approval of vehicles with regard to the installation of lighting and light-signalling devices
Contents
Page
Regulation

1 Communication ................................................................................................................................91

4 Visibility of a red lamp to the front and visibility of a white lamp to the rear .................................109

7 Indication of the downward inclination of the dipped-beam headlamps cut-off referred to in paragraph 6.2.6.1.1. and downward inclination of the front fog lamp cut-off referred to in paragraph 6.3.6.1.2. of this Regulation ............................................................................................117
8 The controls for the headlamp-levelling devices referred to in paragraph 6.2.6.2.2. of this Regulation ........................................................................................................................................118
9 Control of conformity of production ................................................................................................120

chapters.raw_text: This Regulation applies to vehicles of categories M, N, and to their trailers (category O)1 with regard to the installation of lighting and light-signalling devices.
For the purpose of this Regulation:

children.raw_text: "Approval of a vehicle" means the approval of a vehicle type with regard to the number and mode of installation of the lighting and light-signalling devices.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Approval of a vehicle]

children.raw_text:
"Vehicle type with regard to the installation of lighting and light-signalling devices" means vehicles which do not differ in the essential respects mentioned in paragraphs 2.2.1. to 2.2.4.
The following are likewise considered not to be "vehicles of a different type":
vehicles which differ within the meaning of paragraphs 2.2.1. to 2.2.4., but not in such a way as to entail a change in the kind, number, positioning and geometric visibility of the lamps and the inclination of the dipped-beam prescribed for the vehicle type in question, and vehicles on which optional lamps are fitted or are absent:
The dimension and the external shape of the vehicle;
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.2. /2.2.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Vehicle type] - [Dimension and external shape]

children.raw_text: The number and positioning of the devices;
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.2. /2.2.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Vehicle type] - [Number and positioning of devices]

children.raw_text: The headlamp-levelling system;
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.2. /2.2.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Vehicle type] - [Headlamp-levelling system]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.2. /2.2.4. The suspension system.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Vehicle type] - [Suspension system]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Vehicle type]

children.raw_text: "Transverse plane" means a vertical plane perpendicular to the median longitudinal plane of the vehicle.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Transverse plane]

children.raw_text: "Unladen vehicle" means a vehicle without driver, crew, passengers and load, but with a full supply of fuel, spare wheel and the tools normally carried.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.4.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Unladen vehicle]

children.raw_text: "Laden vehicle" means a vehicle loaded to its technically permissible maximum mass, as stated by the manufacturer, who shall also fix the distribution of this mass between the axles in accordance with the method described in Annex 5.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.5.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Laden vehicle]

children.raw_text: "Device" means an element or an assembly of elements used to perform one or more functions.
"Lighting function" means the light emitted by a device to illuminate the road and objects in the direction of vehicle movement.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.6. /2.6.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Device] - [Lighting function]

children.raw_text:
"Light-signalling function" means the light emitted or reflected by a device to give to other road users visual information on the presence, identification and/or the change of movement of the vehicle.
1As defined in the Consolidated Resolution on the Construction of Vehicles (R.E.3.), document ECE/TRANS/WP.29/78/Rev.3, para.2 - www.unece.org/trans/main/wp29/wp29wgs/wp29gen/wp29resolutions.html E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 6
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.6. /2.6.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Device] - [Light-signalling function]

refs.anchor_text: Consolidated Resolution on the Construction of Vehicles

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.6.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Device]

children.raw_text: "Lamp" means a device designed to illuminate the road or to emit a light signal to other road users. Rear registration plate lamps and retro-reflectors are likewise to be regarded as lamps. For the purpose of this Regulation, light-emitting rear registration plates and the service-door-lighting system according to the provisions of Regulation No.107 on vehicles of categories M2 and M3 are not considered as lamps.
"Light source" means one or more elements for visible radiation, which may be assembled with one or more transparent envelopes and with a base for mechanical and electrical connection.
"Replaceable light source" means a light source which is designed to be inserted in and removed from the holder of its device without tool.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Light source] - [Replaceable light source]
[Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Light source] - [Non-replaceable light source]

children.raw_text: "Light source module" means an optical part of a device which is specific to that device. It contains one or more non-replaceable light sources and it may optionally contain one or more holders for approved replaceable light sources.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Light source] - [Light source module]

children.raw_text: "Filament light source" (filament lamp) means a light source where the element for visible radiation is one or more heated filaments producing thermal radiation.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Light source] - [Filament light source]

children.raw_text: "Gas-discharge light source" means a light source where the element for visible radiation is a discharge arc producing electro- luminescence/fluorescence.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Light source] - [Gas-discharge light source]

children.raw_text: "Light-emitting diode (LED) light source" means a light source where the element for visible radiation is one or more solid state junctions producing injection-luminescence/fluorescence.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Light source] - [LED light source]

children.raw_text: "LED module" means a light source module containing as light sources only LEDs. However it may optionally contain one or more holders for approved replaceable light sources.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Light source] - [LED module]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.1. Light source/2.7.1.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Light source] - [Light source definition]

children.raw_text: "Electronic light source control gear" means one or more components between supply and light source, whether or not integrated with the light source or the applied lamp, to control voltage and/ or electrical current of the light source.

"Ballast" means an electronic light source control gear between supply and light source, whether or not integrated with the light source or applied lamp, to stabilise the electrical current of a gas-discharge light source.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Light source] - [Electronic light source control gear] - [Ballast]

children.raw_text:
"Ignitor" means an electronic light source control gear to start the arc of a gas-discharge light source.
E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 7
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Light source] - [Electronic light source control gear] - [Ignitor]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.1. Light source/2.7.1.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Light source] - [Electronic light source control gear]

children.raw_text: "Variable intensity control" means the device which automatically controls rear light signalling devices producing variable luminous intensities to assure the unvarying perception of their signals. The variable intensity control is part of the lamp, or part of the vehicle, or split between the said lamp and the vehicle.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.1. Light source/2.7.1.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Light source] - [Variable intensity control]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.1. Light source
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Light source]

children.raw_text: "Equivalent lamps" means lamps having the same function and authorized in the country in which the vehicle is registered; such lamps may have different characteristics from those installed on the vehicle when it is approved on condition that they satisfy the requirements of this Regulation.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Equivalent lamps]

children.raw_text: "Independent lamps" means devices having separate apparent surfaces in the direction of the reference axis,2 separate light sources and separate lamp bodies.
"Manoeuvring lamp" means a lamp used to provide supplementary illumination to the side of the vehicle to assist during slow manoeuvres.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Independent lamps] - [Manoeuvring lamp]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Independent lamps]

children.raw_text: "Grouped lamps" means devices having separate apparent surfaces in the direction of the reference axis2 and separate light sources, but a common lamp body.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.4.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Grouped lamps]

children.raw_text: "Combined lamps" means devices having separate apparent surfaces in the direction of the reference axis,2 but a common light source and a common lamp body.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.5.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Combined lamps]

children.raw_text: "Reciprocally incorporated lamps" means devices having separate light sources or a single light source operating under different conditions (for example, optical, mechanical, electrical differences), totally or partially common apparent surfaces in the direction of the reference axis2 and a common lamp body.3
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.6.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Reciprocally incorporated lamps]

children.raw_text: "Single-function lamp" means a part of a device which performs a single lighting or light-signalling function.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.7.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Single-function lamp]

children.raw_text: "Concealable lamp" means a lamp capable of being partly or completely hidden when not in use. This result may be achieved by means of a movable cover, by displacement of the lamp or by any other suitable means. The term "retractable" is used more particularly to describe a concealable lamp the displacement of which enables it to be inserted within the bodywork.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.8.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Concealable lamp]

children.raw_text: "Driving-beam (main-beam) headlamp" means the lamp used to illuminate the road over a long distance ahead of the vehicle.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.9.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Driving-beam headlamp]

children.raw_text: "Passing-beam (dipped-beam) headlamp" means the lamp used to illuminate the road ahead of the vehicle without causing undue dazzle or discomfort to oncoming drivers and other road-users.

"Principal passing-beam (principal dipped-beam)" means the dipped-beam produced without the contribution of infrared (IR) emitter and/or additional light sources for bend lighting.
2In the case of lighting devices for the rear registration plate and direction-indicators of categories 5 and 6, the "light-emitting surface" shall be used.
3Examples to enable a decision regarding reciprocal incorporation of lamps can be found in Annex 3, Part 7.
E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 8
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Passing-beam headlamp] - [Principal passing-beam]

refs.anchor_text: examples for reciprocal incorporation of lamps

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.10.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Passing-beam headlamp]

children.raw_text:
"Direction-indicator lamp" means the lamp used to indicate to other road-users that the driver intends to change direction to the right or to the left.
Adirection-indicator lamp or lamps may also be used according to the provisions of Regulation No.97.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.11.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Direction-indicator lamp]

children.raw_text: "Stop lamp" means a lamp used to indicate to other road users to the rear of the vehicle that the longitudinal movement of the vehicle is intentionally retarded.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.12.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Stop lamp]

children.raw_text: "Rear-registration plate illuminating device" means the device used to illuminate the space reserved for the rear registration plate; such a device may consist of several optical components.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.13.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Rear-registration plate illuminating device]

children.raw_text: "Front position lamp" means the lamp used to indicate the presence and the width of the vehicle when viewed from the front.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.14.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Front position lamp]

children.raw_text: "Rear position lamp" means the lamp used to indicate the presence and width of the vehicle when viewed from the rear.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.15.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Rear position lamp]

children.raw_text:
"Retro-reflector" means a device used to indicate the presence of a vehicle by the reflection of light emanating from a light source not connected to the vehicle, the observer being situated near the source.
For the purposes of this Regulation the following are not considered as retro-reflectors:
Retro-reflecting number plates;
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Retro-reflector] - [Retro-reflecting number plates]

children.raw_text: The retro-reflecting signals mentioned in the ADR (European Agreement concerning the international carriage of dangerous goods by road);
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Retro-reflector] - [ADR retro-reflecting signals]

children.raw_text: Other retro-reflective plates and signals which shall be used to comply with national requirements for use as regards certain categories of vehicles or certain methods of operation;
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Retro-reflector] - [Other retro-reflective plates and signals]

children.raw_text: Retro-Reflecting materials approved as ClassD orE according to Regulation No.104 and used for other purposes in compliance with national requirements, e.g. advertising.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Retro-reflector] - [Retro-reflecting materials]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.16.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Retro-reflector]

children.raw_text: "Conspicuity marking" means a device intended to increase the conspicuity of a vehicle, when viewed from the side or rear (or in the case of trailers, additionally from the front), by the reflection of light emanating from a light source not connected to the vehicle, the observer being situated near the source.
"Contour marking" means a conspicuity marking intended to indicate the horizontal and vertical dimensions (length, width and height) of a vehicle.
"Full contour marking" means a contour marking that indicates the outline of the vehicle by a continuous line.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Conspicuity marking] - [Contour marking] - [Full contour marking]

children.raw_text: "Partial contour marking" means a contour marking that indicates the horizontal dimension of the vehicle by a continuous line, and the vertical dimension by marking the upper corners.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Conspicuity marking] - [Contour marking] - [Partial contour marking]
[Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Conspicuity marking] - [Contour marking]

children.raw_text: "Line marking" means a conspicuity marking intended to indicate the horizontal dimensions (length and width) of a vehicle by a continuous line.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Conspicuity marking] - [Line marking]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.17.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Conspicuity marking]

children.raw_text:
"Hazard warning signal" means the simultaneous operation of all of a vehicle's direction-indicator lamps to show that the vehicle temporarily constitutes a special danger to other road-users.
E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 9
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.18.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Hazard warning signal]

children.raw_text: "Front fog lamp" means a lamp used to improve the illumination of the road ahead of the vehicle in case of fog or any similar condition of reduced visibility.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.19.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Front fog lamp]

children.raw_text: "Rear fog lamp" means a lamp used to make the vehicle more easily visible from the rear in dense fog.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.20.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Rear fog lamp]

children.raw_text: "Reversing lamp" means the lamp used to illuminate the road to the rear of the vehicle and to warn other road-users that the vehicle is reversing or about to reverse.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.21.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Reversing lamp]

children.raw_text: "Parking lamp" means a lamp which is used to draw attention to the presence of a stationary vehicle in a built-up area. In such circumstances it replaces the front and rear position lamps.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.22.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Parking lamp]

children.raw_text: "End-outline marker lamp" means the lamp fitted near to the extreme outer edge and as close as possible to the top of the vehicle and intended to indicate clearly the vehicle's overall width. This lamp is intended, for certain vehicles and trailers, to complement the vehicle's front and rear position lamps by drawing particular attention to its bulk.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.23.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [End-outline marker lamp]

children.raw_text: "Side marker lamp" means a lamp used to indicate the presence of the vehicle when viewed from the side.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.24.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Side marker lamp]

children.raw_text: "Daytime running lamp" means a lamp facing in a forward direction used to make the vehicle more easily visible when driving during daytime.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.25.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Daytime running lamp]

children.raw_text: "Cornering lamp" means a lamp used to provide supplementary illumination of that part of the road which is located near the forward corner of the vehicle at the side towards which the vehicle is going to turn.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.26.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Cornering lamp]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.27. "Objective luminous flux" means:
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Objective luminous flux]

children.raw_text: "Adaptive front lighting system" (or "AFS") means a lighting device type- approved according to Regulation No.123, providing beams with differing characteristics for automatic adaptation to varying conditions of use of the dipped-beam (passing-beam) and, if it applies, the main-beam (driving- beam).
"Lighting unit" means a light-emitting component designed to provide or contribute to one or more front lighting function(s) provided by the AFS.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Adaptive front lighting system] - [Lighting unit]

children.raw_text: "Installation unit" means an indivisible housing (lamp body) which contains one or more lighting unit(s).
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Adaptive front lighting system] - [Installation unit]

children.raw_text:
"Lighting mode" or "mode" means a state of a front lighting function provided by the AFS, as specified by the manufacturer and intended for adaptation to specific vehicle and ambient conditions.
E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 10
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Adaptive front lighting system] - [Lighting mode]

children.raw_text: "System control" means that part(s) of the AFS receiving the AFS control signals from the vehicle and controlling the operation of the lighting units automatically.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Adaptive front lighting system] - [System control]

children.raw_text: "AFS control signal" (V, E, W, T) means the input to the AFS in accordance with the paragraph 6.22.7.4. of this Regulation.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Adaptive front lighting system] - [AFS control signal]

children.raw_text: "Neutral state" means the state of the AFS when a defined mode of the class C passing-beam ("basic passing-beam") or of the main beam in the maximum condition of activation, if any, is produced, and no AFS control signal applies.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Adaptive front lighting system] - [Neutral state]

children.raw_text: "Adaptive main-beam" means a main-beam of the AFS that adapts its beam pattern to the presence of oncoming and preceding vehicles in order to improve the long-range visibility for the driver without causing discomfort, distraction or glare to other road users.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Adaptive front lighting system] - [Adaptive main-beam]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.28.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Adaptive front lighting system]

children.raw_text: "Exterior courtesy lamp" means a lamp used to provide supplementary illumination to assist the entry and exit of the vehicle driver and passenger or in loading operations;
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.29.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Exterior courtesy lamp]

children.raw_text: "Interdependent lamp system" means an assembly of two or three interdependent lamps providing the same function.

"Interdependent lamp" means a device operating as part of an interdependent lamp system.  Interdependent lamps operate together when activated, have separate apparent surfaces in the direction of the reference axis and separate lamp bodies, and may have separate light source(s).
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Interdependent lamp system] - [Interdependent lamp]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.30.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Interdependent lamp system]

children.raw_text: "Manoeuvring lamp" means a lamp used to provide supplementary illumination to the side of the vehicle to assist during slow manoeuvres.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7. /2.7.31.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp] - [Manoeuvring lamp]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.7.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Lamp]

children.raw_text:
"Light emitting surface" of a "lighting device", "light-signalling device" or a retro-reflector means the surface as declared in the request for approval by the manufacturer of the device on the drawing, see Annex 3 (see e.g. Parts 1, and 4).
This shall be declared according to one of the following conditions:
(a) In the case where the outer lens is textured, the declared light emitting surface shall be all or part of the exterior surface of the outer lens;
(b) In the case where the outer lens is non-textured the outer lens may be disregarded and the light emitting surface shall be as declared on the drawing, see Annex 3 (see e.g. Part 5).

"Textured outer lens" or "Textured outer lens area" means all or part of an outer lens, designed to modify or influence the propagation of light from the light source(s), such that the light rays are significantly diverted from their original direction.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.8. /2.8.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Light emitting surface] - [Textured outer lens]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.8.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Light emitting surface]

children.raw_text:
"Illuminating surface of a lighting device" (paragraphs 2.7.9., 2.7.10., 2.7.19., 
2.7.21.and 2.7.26.) means the orthogonal projection of the full aperture of the reflector, or in the case of headlamps with an ellipsoidal reflector of the "projection lens", on a transverse plane. If the lighting device has no reflector, the definition of paragraph 2.9.2. shall be applied. If the light emitting surface of the lamp extends over part only of the full aperture of the reflector, then the projection of that part only is taken into account.
E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 11
In the case of a dipped-beam headlamp, the illuminating surface is limited by the apparent trace of the cut-off on to the lens. If the reflector and lens are adjustable relative to one another, the mean adjustment should be used.
In the case of AFS being installed: where a lighting function is produced by two or more simultaneously operated lighting units on a given side of the vehicle, the individual illuminating surfaces, taken together, constitute the illuminating surface to be considered (for example, in the figure of paragraph 6.22.4. below, the individual illuminating surfaces of the lighting units 8, 9 and 11, regarded together and taking into account their respective location, constitute the illuminating surface to be considered for the right hand side of the vehicle).
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.9. "Illuminating surface" (see Annex 3)./2.9.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Illuminating surface] - [Illuminating surface of a lighting device]

children.raw_text:
"Illuminating surface of a light-signalling device other than a retro-reflector" (paragraphs 2.7.11. to 2.7.15., 2.7.18., 2.7.20. and 2.7.22. to 2.7.25) means the orthogonal projection of the lamp in a plane perpendicular to its axis of reference and in contact with the exterior light-emitting surface of the lamp, this projection being bounded by the edges of screens situated in this plane, each allowing only 98 per cent of the total luminous intensity of the light to persist in the direction of the axis of reference.
To determine the lower, upper and lateral limits of the illuminating surface only screens with horizontal or vertical edges shall be used to verify the distance to the extreme edges of the vehicle and the height above the ground.
For other applications of the illuminating surface, e.g. distance between two lamps or functions, the shape of the periphery of this illuminating surface shall be used. The screens shall remain parallel, but other orientations are allowed to be used.
In the case of a light-signalling device whose illuminating surface encloses either totally or partially the illuminating surface of another function or encloses a non-lighted surface, the illuminating surface may be considered to be the light emitting surface itself (see e.g. Annex 3, Parts 2, 3, 5 and 6).
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.9. "Illuminating surface" (see Annex 3)./2.9.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Illuminating surface] - [Illuminating surface of a light-signalling device]

children.raw_text: "Illuminating surface of a retro-reflector" (paragraph 2.7.16.) means, as declared by the applicant during the component approval procedure for the retro-reflectors, the orthogonal projection of a retro-reflector in a plane perpendicular to its axis of reference and delimited by planes contiguous to the declared outermost parts of the retro-reflectors' optical system and parallel to that axis. For the purposes of determining the lower, upper and lateral edges of the device, only horizontal and vertical planes shall be considered.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.9. "Illuminating surface" (see Annex 3)./2.9.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Illuminating surface] - [Illuminating surface of a retro-reflector]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.10.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Apparent surface]

children.raw_text: "Axis of reference" (or "reference axis") means the characteristic axis of the lamp determined by the manufacturer (of the lamp) for use as the direction of reference (H = 0°, V = 0°) for angles of field for photometric measurements and for installing the lamp on the vehicle.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.11.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Axis of reference]

children.raw_text: "Centre of reference" means the intersection of the axis of reference with the exterior light-emitting surface; it is specified by the manufacturer of the lamp.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.12.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Centre of reference]

children.raw_text:
"Angles of geometric visibility" means the angles which determine the field of the minimum solid angle in which the apparent surface of the lamp is visible.
That field of the solid angle is determined by the segments of the sphere of which the centre coincides with the centre of reference of the lamp and the equator is parallel with the ground.  These segments are determined in relation to the axis of reference.  The horizontal angles ß correspond to the longitude and the vertical angles α to the latitude.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.13.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Angles of geometric visibility]

children.raw_text: "Extreme outer edge" on either side of the vehicle, means the plane parallel to the median longitudinal plane of the vehicle and touching its lateral outer edge, disregarding the projection:
Of tyres near their point of contact with the ground, and of connections for tyre-pressure gauges;
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.14. /2.14.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Extreme outer edge] - [Tyres and connections]

children.raw_text: Of any anti-skid devices mounted on the wheels;
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.14. /2.14.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Extreme outer edge] - [Anti-skid devices]

children.raw_text: Of devices for indirect vision;
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.14. /2.14.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Extreme outer edge] - [Devices for indirect vision]

children.raw_text: Of side direction-indicator lamps, end-outline marker lamps, front and rear position lamps, parking lamps, retro-reflectors and side-marker lamps.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.14. /2.14.4.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Extreme outer edge] - [Lamps and reflectors]

children.raw_text: Of customs seals affixed to the vehicle, and of devices for securing and protecting such seals.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.14. /2.14.5.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Extreme outer edge] - [Customs seals]

children.raw_text: Of service-door lighting systems on vehicles of categories M2 and M3 as specified in paragraph 2.7.

children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Extreme outer edge] - [Service-door lighting systems]

children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Extreme outer edge]

children.raw_text: "Overall dimensions" means the distance between the two vertical planes defined in paragraph 2.14. above.
"Overall width" means the distance between the two vertical planes defined in paragraph 2.14. above.

children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Overall dimensions] - [Overall width]

children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Overall dimensions] - [Overall length]

children.raw_text:
(a) A device or part of a device having one lighting or light-signalling function, one or more light source(s) and one apparent surface in the direction of the reference axis, which may be a continuous surface or composed of two or more distinct parts; or (b) Any assembly of two independent lamps, whether identical or not, having the same function, both approved as type "D" lamp and installed so that:
(i) The projection of their apparent surfaces in the direction of the reference axis occupies not less than 60 per cent of the smallest quadrilateral circumscribing the projections of the said apparent surfaces in the direction of the reference axis; or (ii) The distance between two adjacent/tangential distinct parts does not exceed 15 mm when measured perpendicularly to the reference axis; or (c) Any assembly of two independent retro-reflectors, whether identical or not, that have been approved separately and are installed in such a way that:
(i) The projection of their apparent surfaces in the direction of the reference axis occupies not less 60 per cent of the smallest quadrilateral circumscribing the projections of the said apparent surfaces in the direction of the reference axis; or (ii) The distance between two adjacent/tangential distinct parts does not exceed 15 mm when measured perpendicularly to the reference axis.
or
(d) Any interdependent lamp system composed of two or three interdependent lamps providing the same function, approved together as type "Y" and installed so that the distance between adjacent apparent surfaces in the direction of the reference axis does not exceed 75 mm when measured perpendicularly to the reference axis.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.16. "Single and multiple lamps"/2.16.1. "A single lamp" means:
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Single and multiple lamps] - [A single lamp]

children.raw_text:
"Two lamps" or "an even number of lamps", means a single light-emitting surface in the shape of a band or strip if such band or strip is placed symmetrically in relation to the median longitudinal plane of the vehicle, extends on both sides to within at least 0.4 m of the extreme outer edge of the vehicle, and is not less than 0.8 m long; the illumination of such surface shall be provided by not less than two light sources placed as close as possible to its ends; the light-emitting surface may be constituted by a number of juxtaposed elements on condition that the projections of the several individual light-emitting surfaces on a transverse plane occupy not less than
60 per cent of the area of the smallest rectangle circumscribing the projections of the said individual light-emitting surfaces.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.16. "Single and multiple lamps"/2.16.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Single and multiple lamps] - [Two lamps]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.16. "Single and multiple lamps"
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Single and multiple lamps]

children.raw_text:
"Distance between two lamps" which face in the same direction means the shortest distance between the two apparent surfaces in the direction of the reference axis. Where the distance between the lamps clearly meets the E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 14
requirements of the Regulation, the exact edges of apparent surfaces need not be determined.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.17.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Distance between two lamps]

children.raw_text: "Operating tell-tale" means a visual or auditory signal (or any equivalent signal) indicating that a device has been switched on and is operating correctly or not.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.18.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Operating tell-tale]

children.raw_text: "Closed-circuit tell-tale" means a visual (or any equivalent signal) indicating that a device has been switched on, but not indicating whether it is operating correctly or not.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.19.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Closed-circuit tell-tale]

children.raw_text: "Optional lamp" means a lamp, the installation of which is left to the discretion of the manufacturer.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.20.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Optional lamp]

children.raw_text: "Ground" means the surface on which the vehicle stands which should be substantially horizontal.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.21.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Ground]

children.raw_text: "Movable components" of the vehicle mean those body panels or other vehicle parts the position(s) of which can be changed by tilting, rotating or sliding without the use of tools. They do not include tiltable driver cabs of trucks.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.22.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Movable components]

children.raw_text: "Normal position of use of a movable component" means the position(s) of a movable component specified by the vehicle manufacturer for the normal condition of use and the park condition of the vehicle.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.23.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Normal position of use]

children.chapter_title: "Normal condition of use of a vehicle" means:

children.raw_text: For a motor vehicle, when the vehicle is ready to move with its propulsion engine running and its movable components in the normal position(s) as defined in paragraph 2.23.;
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.24. "Normal condition of use of a vehicle" means:/2.24.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Normal condition of use] - [Motor vehicle]

children.raw_text: And for a trailer, when the trailer is connected to a drawing motor vehicle in the conditions as prescribed in paragraph 2.24.1. and its movable components are in the normal position(s) as defined in paragraph 2.23.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.24. "Normal condition of use of a vehicle" means:/2.24.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Normal condition of use] - [Trailer]

children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.24. "Normal condition of use of a vehicle" means:
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Normal condition of use]

children.raw_text: For a motor vehicle, when the vehicle is at standstill and its propulsion engine is not running and its movable components are in the normal position(s) as defined in paragraph 2.23.;
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.25. "Park condition of a vehicle" means:/2.25.1
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Park condition] - [Motor vehicle]

children.raw_text: And for a trailer, when the trailer is connected to a drawing motor vehicle in the condition as described in paragraph 2.25.1. and its movable components are in the normal position(s) as defined in paragraph 2.23.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.25. "Park condition of a vehicle" means:/2.25.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Park condition] - [Trailer]

children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Park condition]

children.raw_text: "Bend lighting" means a lighting function to provide enhanced illumination in bends.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.26.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Bend lighting]

children.raw_text: "Pair" means the set of lamps of the same function on the left- and right-hand side of the vehicle.
"Matched pair" means the set of lamps of the same function on the left- and right-hand side of the vehicle, which, as a pair, complies with the photometric requirements.

"Emergency stop signal" means a signal to indicate to other road users to the rear of the vehicle that a high retardation force has been applied to the vehicle relative to the prevailing road conditions.
E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 15

children.raw_text: "Rear-end collision alert signal (RECAS)" means an automatic signal given by the leading vehicle to the following vehicle. It warns that the following vehicle needs to take emergency action to avoid a collision.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.33.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Rear-end collision alert signal]

children.raw_text:
"Gonio(photo)meter system (if not otherwise specified in a particular Regulation)" means a system used for the photometric measurements specified by the angular coordinates in degrees on a sphere with a vertical polar axis according to CIE publication No.70, Vienna 1987, i.e.
corresponding to a gonio(photo)meter system with a horizontal ("elevation") axis fixed to the ground and a second, moveable ("rotation") axis perpendicular to the fixed horizontal axis (see Annex 14 to this Regulation).
Note: The above mentioned CIE publication specifies a procedure to correct the angular coordinates in the case where an alternative gonio(photo)meter system is used.
children.full_path: 2. Definitions/2.34.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [Goniometer system]

"H plane" means the horizontal plane containing the centre of reference of the lamp.
E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 19

children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Definitions] - [H plane]

children.raw_text: The application for approval of a vehicle type with regard to the installation of its lighting and light-signalling devices shall be submitted by the manufacturer or his duly accredited representative.
children.full_path: 3. Application for approval/3.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Type approval application] - [Submission]

children.raw_text: It shall be accompanied by the following documents and particulars in triplicate:

A description of the vehicle type with regard to the items mentioned in paragraphs 2.2.1. to 2.2.4. above, together with the restrictions on loading, particularly the maximum permissible load in the boot;
children.full_path: 3. Application for approval/3.2. /3.2.1.

and the centre of reference as defined in paragraph 2.12. This information is not necessary in the case of the rear registration plate lamp (paragraph 2.7.13.);

The lighting functions and modes for which the AFS has been approved;

children.raw_text: The lamps that are grouped or combined with or reciprocally incorporated in the AFS;

children.raw_text: An unladen vehicle fitted with a complete set of lighting and light-signalling equipment, as prescribed in paragraph 3.2.2. above, and representative of the vehicle type to be approved shall be submitted to the Technical Service responsible for conducting approval tests.

chapters.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Vehicle lighting and light-signalling devices installation] - [Type approval application]

children.raw_text: If the vehicle type submitted for approval pursuant to this Regulation meets the requirements of the Regulation in respect of all the devices specified in the list, approval of that vehicle type shall be granted.
children.full_path: 4. Approval/4.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Vehicle Type Approval] - [Approval Conditions]

children.raw_text: An approval number shall be assigned to each type approved. Its first two digits (at present 06, corresponding to the 06 series of amendments) shall indicate the series of amendments incorporating the most recent major technical amendments made to the Regulation at the time of issue of the approval. The same Contracting Party shall not assign this number to another vehicle type or to the same vehicle type submitted with equipment not specified in the list referred to in paragraph 3.2.2. above, subject to the provisions of paragraph 7. of this Regulation.
children.full_path: 4. Approval/4.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Vehicle Type Approval] - [Approval Number]

children.raw_text: Notice of approval or of extension or refusal of approval or production definitively discontinued of a vehicle type/part pursuant to this Regulation shall be communicated to the Parties to the 1958 Agreement applying this Regulation, by means of a form conforming to the model in Annex 1 to this Regulation.
children.full_path: 4. Approval/4.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Vehicle Type Approval] - [Notification Process]

children.raw_text: There shall be affixed, conspicuously and in a readily accessible place specified on the approval form, to every vehicle conforming to a vehicle type approved under this Regulation, an international approval mark consisting of:
A circle surrounding the letter "E" followed by the distinguishing number of the country which has granted approval; 5
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Vehicle Type Approval] - [Approval Mark] - [Components]

children.raw_text: The number of this Regulation, followed by the letter "R", a dash and the approval number to the right of the circle prescribed in paragraph 4.4.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Vehicle Type Approval] - [Approval Mark] - [Number Format]

children.full_path: 4. Approval/4.4.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Vehicle Type Approval] - [Approval Mark]

children.raw_text:
If the vehicle conforms to a vehicle type approved, under one or more other Regulations annexed to the Agreement, in the country which has granted approval under this Regulation, the symbol prescribed in paragraph 4.4.1.
need not to be repeated, in such a case the Regulation and approval numbers and the additional symbols of all the Regulations under which approval has been granted in the country which has granted approval under this Regulation shall be placed in vertical columns to the right of the symbol prescribed in paragraph 4.4.1.
children.full_path: 4. Approval/4.5.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Vehicle Type Approval] - [Multiple Regulations Approval]

children.raw_text:
The approval mark shall be clearly legible and be indelible. 
5The distinguishing numbers of the Contracting Parties to the 1958 Agreement are reproduced in Annex 3 to the Consolidated Resolution on the Construction of Vehicles (R.E.3), document ECE/TRANS/WP.29/78/Rev.3, Annex 3 - www.unece.org/trans/main/wp29/wp29wgs/wp29gen/wp29resolutions.html E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 21

children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Vehicle Type Approval] - [Approval Mark] - [Legibility Requirements]
