chapters.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Vehicle Type Approval] - [Approval Process]

children.raw_text: The lighting and light-signalling devices shall be so fitted that under normal conditions of use as defined in paragraphs 2.24., 2.24.1. and 2.24.2. and notwithstanding any vibrations to which they may be subjected, they retain the characteristics prescribed by this Regulation and enable the vehicle to comply with the requirements of this Regulation. In particular, it shall not be possible for the lamps to be inadvertently maladjusted.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Installation and retention requirements]

children.raw_text: The illuminating lamps described in paragraphs 2.7.9., 2.7.10. and 2.7.19. shall be so installed that correct adjustment of their orientation can easily be carried out.

In the case of headlamps fitted with measures to prevent discomfort to other road-users in a country where traffic operates on the side of the road opposite to that of the country for which the headlamp was designed, such measures shall be achieved automatically or by the vehicle user with the vehicle in the park condition without the need for special tools (other than those provided with the vehicle6). Detailed instructions shall be provided by the vehicle manufacturer with the vehicle.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.2. /5.2.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Orientation adjustment requirements] - [Headlamp adjustment for opposite traffic]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Orientation adjustment requirements]

children.raw_text: For all light-signalling devices, including those mounted on the side panels, the reference axis of the lamp when fitted to the vehicle shall be parallel to the bearing plane of the vehicle on the road; in addition it shall be perpendicular to the median longitudinal plane of the vehicle in the case of side retro-reflectors and of side-marker lamps and parallel to that plane in the case of all other signalling devices. In each direction a tolerance of  3° shall be allowed. In addition, any specific instructions as regards fitting laid down by the manufacturer shall be complied with.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Light-signalling device orientation]

children.raw_text: In the absence of specific instructions, the height and orientation of the lamps shall be verified with the vehicle unladen and placed on a flat, horizontal surface, in the condition defined in paragraphs 2.24., 2.24.1. and 2.24.2. and, in the case where an AFS is installed, with the system in its neutral state.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.4.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Height and orientation verification]

children.raw_text: In the absence of specific instructions lamps constituting a pair shall:

Be fitted to the vehicle symmetrically in relation to the median longitudinal plane (this estimate to be based on the exterior geometrical form of the lamp and not on the edge of its illuminating surface referred to in paragraph 2.9.);
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.5. /5.5.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Pair lamp requirements] - [Symmetry to median longitudinal plane]

children.raw_text: Be symmetrical to one another in relation to the median longitudinal plane, this requirement is not valid with regard to the interior structure of the lamp;
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.5. /5.5.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Pair lamp requirements] - [Symmetry between lamps]

children.raw_text:
Satisfy the same colorimetric requirements and have substantially identical photometric characteristics. This shall not apply to a matched pair of Class F3 front fog lamps;
6This does not apply to dedicated objects that may be added to the exterior of the headlamp. E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 22
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.5. /5.5.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Pair lamp requirements] - [Colorimetric and photometric requirements]

children.raw_text: Have substantially identical photometric characteristics.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.5. /5.5.4.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Pair lamp requirements] - [Photometric characteristics]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.5.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Pair lamp requirements]

children.raw_text: On vehicles whose external shape is asymmetrical the above requirements shall be satisfied so far as is possible.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.6.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Asymmetrical vehicle requirements]

children.raw_text: Grouped, combined or reciprocally incorporated lamps

Lamps may be grouped, combined or reciprocally incorporated with one another provided that all requirements regarding colour, position, orientation, geometric visibility, electrical connections and other requirements, if any, are fulfilled.

The photometric and colorimetric requirements of a lamp shall be fulfilled when all other functions with which this lamp is grouped, combined or reciprocally incorporated are switched OFF.
However, when a front or rear position lamp is reciprocally incorporated with one or more other function(s) which can be activated together with them, the requirements regarding colour of each of these other functions shall be fulfilled when the reciprocally incorporated function(s) and the front or rear position lamps are switched ON.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.7 /5.7.1. /5.7.1.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Grouped, combined or reciprocally incorporated lamps] - [Photometric and colorimetric requirements]

children.raw_text: Stop lamps and direction-indicator lamps are not permitted to be reciprocally incorporated.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.7 /5.7.1. /5.7.1.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Grouped, combined or reciprocally incorporated lamps] - [Stop and direction-indicator lamp restrictions]

children.raw_text: Where stop lamps and direction-indicator lamps are grouped, the following conditions shall be met:

Any horizontal or vertical straight line passing through the projections of the apparent surfaces of these functions on a plane perpendicular to the reference axis, shall not intersect more than two borderlines separating adjacent areas of different colour;
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Grouped, combined or reciprocally incorporated lamps] - [Borderline intersection limit]

children.raw_text: Their apparent surfaces in the direction of the reference axis, based upon the areas bounded by the outline of their light emitting surfaces, do not overlap.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Grouped, combined or reciprocally incorporated lamps] - [Apparent surface non-overlap]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.7 /5.7.1. /5.7.1.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Grouped, combined or reciprocally incorporated lamps] - [Grouped stop and direction-indicator lamp conditions]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.7 /5.7.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Grouped, combined or reciprocally incorporated lamps] - [General requirements]

children.raw_text: Where the apparent surface of a single lamp is composed of two or more distinct parts, it shall satisfy the following requirements:

Either the total area of the projection of the distinct parts on a plane tangent to the exterior surface of the outer lens and perpendicular to the reference axis shall occupy not less than 60 per cent of the smallest quadrilateral circumscribing the said projection, or the distance between two adjacent/tangential distinct parts shall not exceed 15 mm when measured perpendicularly to the reference axis. This requirement shall not apply to a retro-reflector.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.7 /5.7.2. /5.7.2.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Grouped, combined or reciprocally incorporated lamps] - [Projection area or distance requirements]

children.raw_text: Or, in the case of interdependent lamps, the distance between adjacent apparent surfaces in the direction of the reference axis does not exceed 75 mm when measured perpendicularly to the reference axis.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.7 /5.7.2. /5.7.2.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Grouped, combined or reciprocally incorporated lamps] - [Interdependent lamp distance]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.7 /5.7.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Grouped, combined or reciprocally incorporated lamps] - [Single lamp with distinct parts]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.7
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Grouped, combined or reciprocally incorporated lamps]

children.raw_text:
The maximum height above the ground shall be measured from the highest point and the minimum height from the lowest point of the apparent surface in the direction of the reference axis.
Where the (maximum and minimum) height above the ground clearly meets the requirements of the Regulation, the exact edges of any surface need not be determined.
E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 23
For the purposes of reducing the geometric visibility angles, the position of a lamp with regard to height above the ground, shall be measured from the H plane.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.8. /5.8.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Height above ground measurement] - [Geometric visibility height reference]

children.raw_text: In the case of dipped-beam headlamp, the minimum height in relation to the ground is measured from the lowest point of the effective outlet of the optical system (e.g. reflector, lens, projection lens) independent of its utilization.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.8. /5.8.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Height above ground measurement] - [Dipped-beam headlamp height measurement]

children.raw_text:
The position, as regards width, will be determined from that edge of the apparent surface in the direction of the reference axis which is the furthest from the median longitudinal plane of the vehicle when referred to the overall width, and from the inner edges of the apparent surface in the direction of the reference axis when referred to the distance between lamps.
Where the position, as regards width, clearly meets the requirements of the Regulation, the exact edges of any surface need not be determined.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.8. /5.8.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Height above ground measurement] - [Width position determination]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.8.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Height above ground measurement]

children.raw_text: In the absence of specific instructions, the photometric characteristics (e.g. intensity, colour, apparent surface, etc.) of a lamp shall not be intentionally varied during the period of activation of the lamp.
Direction-indicator lamps, the vehicle-hazard warning signal, amber side- marker lamps complying with paragraph 6.18.7. below, and the emergency stop signal shall be flashing lamps.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.9. /5.9.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Photometric characteristics variation] - [Flashing lamps]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.9. /5.9.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Photometric characteristics variation] - [Allowed variation conditions]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.9.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Photometric characteristics variation]

children.raw_text: No red light which could give rise to confusion shall be emitted from a lamp as defined in paragraph 2.7. in a forward direction and no white light which could give rise to confusion, shall be emitted from a lamp as defined in paragraph 2.7. in a rearward direction. No account shall be taken of lighting devices fitted for the interior lighting of the vehicle. In case of doubt, this requirement shall be verified as follows:

For the visibility of red light towards the front of a vehicle, with the exception of a red rearmost side-marker lamp, there shall be no direct visibility of the apparent surface of a red lamp if viewed by an observer moving within Zone 1 as specified in Annex 4;
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.10. /5.10.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Light color confusion prevention] - [Red light forward visibility]

children.raw_text:
For the visibility of white light towards the rear, with the exception of reversing lamps and white side conspicuity markings fitted to the vehicle, there shall be no direct visibility of the apparent surface of a white lamp if viewed by an observer moving within Zone 2 in a transverse plane situated
25m behind the vehicle (see Annex 4);
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.10. /5.10.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Light color confusion prevention] - [White light rearward visibility]

children.raw_text:
In width, by two vertical planes which, forming to the front and to the rear respectively an angle of 15° outwards from the vehicle's median longitudinal plane, pass through the point or points of contact of vertical planes parallel to the vehicle's median longitudinal plane delimiting the vehicle's overall width;
if there are several points of contact, the foremost shall correspond to the forward plane and the rearmost to the rearward plane.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.10. /5.10.3. /5.10.3.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Light color confusion prevention] - [Width boundaries]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.10. /5.10.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Light color confusion prevention] - [Observer zone boundaries]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.10.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Light color confusion prevention]

children.raw_text: The electrical connections shall be such that the front and rear position lamps, the end-outline marker lamps, if they exist, the side-marker lamps, if they exist, and the rear registration plate lamp can only be switched ON and OFF simultaneously.
When front and rear position lamps are switched ON, as well as side-marker lamps when combined or reciprocally incorporated with said lamps, as parking lamps; or
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.11. /5.11.1. This condition does not apply:/5.11.1.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Electrical connection requirements] - [Parking lamp exception]

children.raw_text: When side-marker lamps flash in conjunction with direction indicators; or
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.11. /5.11.1. This condition does not apply:/5.11.1.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Electrical connection requirements] - [Side-marker lamp flashing exception]

children.raw_text: When light signalling system operates according to 6.2.7.6.2.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.11. /5.11.1. This condition does not apply:/5.11.1.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Electrical connection requirements] - [Light signalling system exception]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.11. /5.11.1. This condition does not apply:
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Electrical connection requirements] - [Exceptions]

children.raw_text: To front position lamps when their function is substituted under the provisions of paragraph 5.12.1. below.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.11. /5.11.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Electrical connection requirements] - [Front position lamp substitution]

children.raw_text: In the case of an interdependent lamp system, all light sources shall be switched ON and OFF simultaneously.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.11. /5.11.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Electrical connection requirements] - [Interdependent lamp system switching]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.11.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Electrical connection requirements]

children.raw_text: The electrical connections shall be such that the main-beam and dipped-beam headlamps and the front fog lamps cannot be switched on unless the lamps referred to in paragraph 5.11. are also switched on. This requirement shall not apply, however, to main-beam or dipped-beam headlamps when their luminous warnings consist of the intermittent lighting up at short intervals of the main-beam headlamp or the intermittent lighting up at short intervals of the dipped-beam headlamp or the alternate lighting up at short intervals of the main-beam and dipped-beam headlamps.
The dipped-beam headlamps and/or the main-beam headlamps and/or the front fog lamps may substitute the function of the front position lamps, provided that:
Their electrical connections are such that in case of failure of any of these lighting devices the front position lamps are automatically re-activated; and
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.12. /5.12.1. /5.12.1.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Headlamp and fog lamp switching] - [Automatic re-activation]

children.raw_text:
The substituting lamp/function meets, for the respective position lamp, the requirements concerning:
(a) The geometric visibility prescribed for the front position lamps in
6.9.5; and (b) The minimum photometric values according to the angles of light distribution; and
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.12. /5.12.1. /5.12.1.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Headlamp and fog lamp switching] - [Substituting lamp requirements]

refs.anchor_text: geometric visibility for front position lamps

children.raw_text: Appropriate evidence demonstrating compliance with the requirements indicated in paragraph 5.12.1.2. above is provided in the test reports of the substituting lamp.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.12. /5.12.1. /5.12.1.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Headlamp and fog lamp switching] - [Compliance evidence]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.12. /5.12.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Headlamp and fog lamp switching] - [Position lamp substitution]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.12.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Headlamp and fog lamp switching]

children.raw_text:
Where a closed-circuit tell-tale is prescribed by this Regulation it may be replaced by an "operating" tell-tale.
E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 25
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.13. Tell-tale
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Tell-tale]

children.raw_text: The concealment of lamps shall be prohibited, with the exception of the main-beam headlamps, the dipped-beam headlamps and the front fog lamps, which may be concealed when they are not in use.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.14. Concealable lamps/5.14.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Concealable lamps] - [Concealment prohibition]

children.raw_text: In the event of any failure affecting the operation of the concealment device(s) the lamps shall remain in the position of use, if already in use, or shall be capable of being moved into the position of use without the aid of tools.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.14. Concealable lamps/5.14.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Concealable lamps] - [Failure handling]

children.raw_text: It shall be possible to move the lamps into the position of use and to switch them on by means of a single control, without excluding the possibility of moving them into the position of use without switching them on. However, in the case of grouped main-beam and dipped-beam headlamps, the control referred to above is required only to activate the dipped-beam headlamps.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.14. Concealable lamps/5.14.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Concealable lamps] - [Control requirements]

children.raw_text:
It shall not be possible deliberately, from the driver's seat, to stop the movement of switched-on lamps before they reach the position of use. If there is a danger of dazzling other road users by the movement of the lamps, they may light up only when they have reached their position of use.
5.14.5.When the concealment device has a temperature of -30 °C to +50 °C the headlamps shall be capable of reaching the position of use within three seconds of initial operation of the control.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.14. Concealable lamps/5.14.4.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Concealable lamps] - [Movement and lighting]

parameters.item: time to reach position of use

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.14. Concealable lamps
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Concealable lamps]

children.raw_text:
The colours of the light emitted by the lamps7 are the following: Main-beam headlamp: White Dipped-beam headlamp: White Front fog lamp: White or selective yellow Reversing lamp: White Direction-indicator lamp: Amber Hazard warning signal: Amber Stop lamp: Red Emergency stop signal : Amber or red Rear-end collision alert signal: Amber Rear registration plate lamp: White Front position lamp: White Rear position lamp: Red Front fog lamp White or selective yellow Rear fog lamp: Red Parking lamp: White in front, red at the rear, amber if reciprocally incorporated in the side direction-indicator lamps or in the side-marker lamps.
7Measurement of the chromaticity coordinates of the light emitted by the lamps is not part of this regulation.
E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 26
Side-marker lamp: Amber; however the rearmost side- marker lamp can be red if it is grouped or combined or reciprocally incorporated with the rear position lamp, the rear end-outline marker lamp, the rear fog lamp, the stop lamp or is grouped or has part of the light emitting surface in common with the rear retro-reflector.
End-outline marker lamp: White in front, red at the rear Daytime running lamp: White Rear retro-reflector, non- triangular:
Red
Rear retro-reflector, triangular: Red Front retro-reflector, non- triangular:
Identical to incident light8 Side retro-reflector, non- triangular:
Amber; however the rearmost side retro-reflector can be red if it is grouped or has part of the light emitting surface in common with the rear position lamp, the rear end outline marker lamp, the rear fog lamp, the stop-lamp, the red rearmost side-marker lamp or the rear retro-reflector, non- triangular.
Cornering lamp: White Conspicuity marking: White to the front;
White or yellow to the side;
Red or yellow to the rear.9 Adaptive front-lighting systems (AFS):
White
Exterior courtesy lamp: White Manoeuvring lamp: White
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.15.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Light colors]

children.raw_text: The number of lamps mounted on the vehicle shall be equal to the number indicated in the individual specifications of this Regulation.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.16. Number of lamps/5.16.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Number of lamps] - [Mounting quantity]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.16. Number of lamps
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Number of lamps]

children.raw_text: Any lamp may be installed on movable components provided that the conditions specified in paragraphs 5.18., 5.19. and 5.20. are fulfilled.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.17.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Movable component installation]

children.raw_text: Rear position lamps, rear direction-indicators and rear retro-reflectors, triangular as well as non-triangular, may be installed on movable components only:

If at all fixed positions of the movable components the lamps on the movable components meet all the position, geometric visibility, colorimetric and photometric requirements for those lamps.
8Also known as white or colourless retro-reflector.
9Nothing in this Regulation shall preclude the Contracting Parties applying this Regulation from allowing the use of white conspicuity markings to the rear in their territories.
E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 27
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.18. /5.18.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Movable component installation] - [Fixed position requirements]

children.raw_text:
In the case where the functions referred to in paragraph 5.18. are obtained by an assembly of two lamps marked "D" (see paragraph 2.16.1.), only one of the lamps needs to meet the position, geometric visibility and photometric requirements for those lamps at all fixed positions of the movable components.
or
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.18. /5.18.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Movable component installation] - [Dual lamp assembly]

children.raw_text: Where additional lamps for the above functions are fitted and are activated, when the movable component is in any fixed open position, provided that these additional lamps satisfy all the position, geometric visibility and photometric requirements applicable to the lamps installed on the movable component.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.18. /5.18.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Movable component installation] - [Additional lamps]

children.raw_text:
In the case where the functions referred to in paragraph 5.18. are obtained by an interdependent lamp system either of the following conditions shall apply:
(a) Should the complete interdependent lamp system be mounted on the moving component(s), the requirements of paragraph 5.18.1. shall be satisfied. However, additional lamps for the above functions may be activated, when the movable component is in any fixed open position, provided that these additional lamps satisfy all the position, geometric visibility, colorimetric and photometric requirements applicable to the lamps installed on the movable component.
or
(b) Should the interdependent lamp system be partly mounted on the fixed component and partly mounted on a movable component, with the exception of direction indicator lamps, the interdependent lamp(s) specified by the Applicant during the device approval procedure shall meet all the position, outwards geometric visibility, colorimetric and photometric requirements for those lamps, at all fixed positions of the movable component(s).
The inwards geometric visibility requirement(s) is(are) deemed to be satisfied if this(these) interdependent lamp(s) still conform(s) to the photometric values prescribed in the field of light distribution for the approval of the device, at all fixed positions of the movable component(s).
For direction indicator lamps, the interdependent lamp(s) specified by the Applicant during the device approval procedure shall meet all the position, geometric visibility, photometric and colorimetric requirements at all fixed positions of the movable component(s). This does not apply where, to fulfil or complete the geometric visibility angle, additional lamps are activated when the movable component is in any fixed open position, provided that these additional lamps satisfy all the position, photometric and colorimetric requirements applicable to the direction indicator lamps installed on the movable component.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.18. /5.18.4.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Movable component installation] - [Interdependent lamp system]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.18.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Movable component installation] - [Rear lamp restrictions]

children.raw_text: When the movable components are in a position other than a "normal position of use", the devices installed on them shall not cause undue discomfort to road users.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.19.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Movable component discomfort]

children.raw_text:
When a lamp is installed on a movable component and the movable component is in the "normal position(s) of use", the lamp shall always return to the position(s) specified by the manufacturer in accordance with this E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 28
Regulation. In the case of dipped-beam headlamps and front fog lamps, this requirement shall be considered satisfied if, when the movable components are moved and returned to the normal position 10 times, no value of the angular inclination of these lamps, relative to its support, measured after each operation of the movable component, differs by more than 0.15 per cent from the average of the 10 measured values. If this value is exceeded each limit specified in paragraph 6.2.6.1.1. shall then be modified by this excess to decrease the allowed range of inclinations when checking the vehicle according to Annex 6.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.20.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Movable component position return]

children.raw_text:
The apparent surface in the direction of the reference axis of front and rear position lamps, front and rear direction-indicator lamps and retro-reflectors shall not be hidden more than 50 per cent by any movable component, with or without a light-signalling device installed on it, in any fixed position different from the "normal position of use".
Fixed position of a movable component means the stable or natural rest position(s) of the movable component specified by the vehicle manufacturer, whether locked or not.
If the above requirement is not practicable:

Additional lamps satisfying all the position, geometric visibility, colorimetric and photometric requirements for the above indicated lamps shall be activated when the apparent surface in the direction of the reference axis of these lamps is more than 50 per cent hidden by the movable component; or
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.21. /5.21.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Apparent surface hiding] - [Additional lamp activation]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.21. /5.21.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Apparent surface hiding] - [Communication form remark]

children.raw_text: Paragraph 5.21.2. does not apply to retro-reflectors.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.21. /5.21.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Apparent surface hiding] - [Retro-reflector exclusion]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.21.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Apparent surface hiding]

children.raw_text: With the exception of retro-reflectors, a lamp even bearing an approval mark is deemed not to be present when it cannot be made to operate by the sole installation of a light source and/or a fuse.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.22.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Lamp operability]

children.raw_text: Lamps approved with light source(s) according to Regulation No.37, except when such light sources are used as non-replaceable light source(s) as defined in paragraph 2.7.1.1.2. of this Regulation, shall be fitted in a vehicle in such a way that the light source can be correctly replaced without the need for expert assistance and without the need for special tools, other than those provided with the vehicle by the manufacturer. The vehicle manufacturer shall provide with the vehicle a detailed description of the procedure for replacement.

In the case where a light source module includes a holder for an approved replaceable light source according to Regulation No.37, this light source shall be replaceable as required in paragraph 5.23. above.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.23. /5.23.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Light source replacement] - [Light source module holder]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.23.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Light source replacement]

children.raw_text:
Any temporary fail-safe replacement of the light-signalling function of a rear position lamp is allowed, provided that the replacement function in case of a failure is similar in colour, main intensity and position to the function that has ceased to operate and provided that the replacement device remains E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 29
operational in its original safety function. During replacement, a tell-tale on the dashboard (paragraph 2.18. of this Regulation) shall indicate occurrence of a temporary replacement and need for repair.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.24.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Temporary fail-safe replacement]

children.raw_text: Where an AFS is fitted, it shall be considered equivalent to a pair of dipped- beam headlamps and, if it provides main-beam function(s), it shall be considered equivalent to a pair of main-beam headlamps.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.25.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [AFS equivalence]

children.raw_text: Rear direction-indicator lamps, rear position lamps, stop lamps (except stop lamps of category S4) and rear fog lamps with variable luminous intensity control are allowed, which respond simultaneously to at least one of the following external influences: ambient lighting, fog, snowfall, rain, spray, dust clouds, contamination of the light emitting surface, provided that their prescribed intensity relationship is maintained throughout variation transitions. No sharp variation of intensity shall be observed during transition. Stop lamps of category S4 may produce variable luminous intensity independent from the other lamps. It may be possible for the driver to set the functions above to luminous intensities corresponding to their steady category and to return them to their automatic variable category.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.26.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Variable luminous intensity control]

children.raw_text:
For vehicles of M and N categories, the applicant shall demonstrate to the Technical Service responsible for type approval testing that the electric power supply conditions for the devices indicated in paragraphs
2.7.9., 2.7.10., 2.7.12., 2.7.14. and 2.7.15. above comply, when the electrical system of the vehicle is in a constant voltage operating condition, representative for the relevant category of powered vehicle as specified by the applicant, with the following provisions:

The voltage supplied at the terminals of devices which, according to their type approval documentation, have been tested by the application of a special power supply/electronic light source control gear, or in a secondary operating mode or at a voltage requested by the applicant, shall not exceed the voltage specified for the relevant devices or functions as they have been approved.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.27. /5.27.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Electric power supply] - [Voltage limit for special devices]

children.raw_text: In all cases of electric power supply conditions not covered by paragraph 5.27.1., the voltage at the terminals of the device(s) or function(s) shall not exceed 6.75 V (6 Volt-Systems), 13.5 V (12 Volt-Systems) or 28 V (24 Volt-Systems) by more than 3 per cent. The means of controlling the maximum voltage at the terminals of the device may, for convenience, be located within the body of the device.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.27. /5.27.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Electric power supply] - [Voltage limit for standard devices]

children.raw_text: The provisions of paragraphs 5.27.1. and 5.27.2. shall not apply to devices which include an electronic light source control gear or a variable intensity control being part of the device.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.27. /5.27.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Electric power supply] - [Electronic control gear exclusion]

children.raw_text: A report shall be attached to the approval documentation describing the methods used to demonstrate compliance and the results obtained.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.27. /5.27.4.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Electric power supply] - [Compliance report]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.27.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Electric power supply]

children.raw_text: General provisions relating to geometric visibility

There shall be no obstacle on the inside of the angles of geometric visibility to the propagation of light from any part of the apparent surface of the lamp observed from infinity. However, no account is taken of obstacles, if they were already presented when the lamp was type-approved.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.28. /5.28.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Geometric visibility] - [Obstacle prohibition]

children.raw_text:
If measurements are taken closer to the lamp, the direction of observation shall be shifted parallel to achieve the same accuracy.
E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 30
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.28. /5.28.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Geometric visibility] - [Measurement direction]

children.raw_text: If, when the lamp is installed, any part of the apparent surface of the lamp is hidden by any further parts of the vehicle, proof shall be furnished that the part of the lamp not hidden by obstacles still conforms to the photometric values prescribed for the approval of the device.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.28. /5.28.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Geometric visibility] - [Hidden surface proof]

children.raw_text: When the vertical angle of geometric visibility below the horizontal may be reduced to 5º (lamp at less than 750 mm above the ground measured according to the provisions of paragraph 5.8.1. above) the photometric field of measurements of the installed optical unit may be reduced to 5º below the horizontal.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.28. /5.28.4.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Geometric visibility] - [Vertical angle reduction]

parameters.item: vertical angle of geometric visibility below horizontal

children.raw_text: In the case of an interdependent lamp system the geometric visibility requirements shall be fulfilled when all its interdependent lamps are operated together.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.28. /5.28.5.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Geometric visibility] - [Interdependent lamp system]

children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.28.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [Geometric visibility]

children.raw_text: A LED module does not need to be replaceable, if so stated in the communication sheet of the component type approval.
children.full_path: 5. General specifications/5.29.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications] - [LED module replaceability]

chapters.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[General specifications for lighting and light-signalling devices]

children.raw_text: Mandatory on motor vehicles. Prohibited on trailers.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.1. Presence
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Presence]

children.raw_text:
Two or four, type approved according to Regulations Nos.98 or 112, excluding Class A headlamp.
For vehicles of the category N3: Two extra main-beam headlamps may be installed.
Where a vehicle is fitted with four concealable headlamps the installation of two additional headlamps shall only be authorized for the purpose of light-signalling, consisting of intermittent illumination, at short intervals (see paragraph 5.12. above) in daylight.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.2. Number
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Number]

children.raw_text: No individual specifications.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.3. Arrangement
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Arrangement]

children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.4. Position/6.1.4.1. In width: No individual specifications.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Position] - [In width]

children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.4. Position/6.1.4.2. In height: No individual specifications.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Position] - [In height]

children.raw_text: In length: At the front of the vehicle. This requirement shall be deemed to be satisfied if the light emitted does not cause discomfort to the driver either directly or indirectly through the devices for indirect vision and/or other reflecting surfaces of the vehicle.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.4. Position/6.1.4.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Position] - [In length]

children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.4. Position
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Position]

children.raw_text:
The visibility of the illuminating surface, including its visibility in areas which do not appear to be illuminated in the direction of observation considered, shall be ensured within a divergent space defined by generating lines based on the perimeter of the illuminating surface and forming an angle of not less than 5° with the axis of reference of the headlamp. The origin of E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 31
the angles of geometric visibility is the perimeter of the projection of the illuminating surface on a transverse plane tangent to the foremost part of the lens of the headlamp.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.5. Geometric visibility
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Geometric visibility]

children.raw_text:
Towards the front.
Not more than one main-beam headlamp on each side of the vehicle may swivel to produce bend lighting.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.6. Orientation
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Orientation]

children.raw_text: Except when they are used to give intermittent luminous warnings at short intervals the main-beam headlamps may be switched ON, only when the master light switch is in headlamps ON position or in "AUTO" (automatic) position and the conditions for automatic activation of dipped-beam exist. In the latter case, the main beam headlamps shall be switched off automatically when the conditions for automatic activation of dipped-beam ceased to exist.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.7. Electrical connections/6.1.7.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Electrical connections] - [Switching conditions]

children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.7. Electrical connections/6.1.7.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Electrical connections] - [Automatic control]

children.raw_text:
It shall always be possible to switch the main-beam headlamps  ON and OFF manually and to manually switch OFF the automatic control of the main- beam headlamps.
Moreover, the switching OFF, of the main-beam headlamps and of their automatic control, shall be by means of a simple  and immediate manual operation; the use of sub-menus is not allowed.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.7. Electrical connections/6.1.7.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Electrical connections] - [Manual control]

children.raw_text:
The main-beam headlamps may be switched on either simultaneously or in pairs. In case the extra two main-beam headlamps are installed, as permitted under paragraph 6.1.2. for vehicles of the category N3 only, no more than two pairs may be simultaneously lit. For changing over from the dipped to the main beam at least one pair of main-beam headlamps shall be switched on.
For changing over from the main-beam to the dipped-beam all main-beam headlamps shall be switched off simultaneously.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.7. Electrical connections/6.1.7.4.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Electrical connections] - [Switching pairs]

children.raw_text: The dipped-beams may remain switched on at the same time as the main beams.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.7. Electrical connections/6.1.7.5.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Electrical connections] - [Dipped-beam operation]

children.raw_text:
Where four concealable headlamps are fitted their raised position shall prevent the simultaneous operation of any additional headlamps fitted, if E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 32
these are intended to provide light signals consisting of intermittent illumination at short intervals (paragraph 5.12.) in daylight.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.7. Electrical connections/6.1.7.6.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Electrical connections] - [Concealable headlamps]

children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.7. Electrical connections
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Electrical connections]

children.raw_text: Circuit-closed tell-tale mandatory.

If the control of the main-beam headlamps is automatic as described in paragraph 6.1.7.1. above an indication shall be provided to the driver that the automatic control of the main-beam function is activated. This information shall remain displayed as long as the automatic operation is activated.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.8. Tell-tale/6.1.8.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Tell-tale] - [Automatic control indication]

children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.8. Tell-tale
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Tell-tale]

children.raw_text: The aggregate maximum intensity of the main-beam headlamps which can be switched on simultaneously shall not exceed 430,000 cd, which corresponds to a reference value of 100.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.9. Other requirements/6.1.9.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Other requirements] - [Maximum intensity]

children.raw_text: This maximum intensity shall be obtained by adding together the individual reference marks which are indicated on the several. The reference mark "10" shall be given to each of the headlamps marked "R" or "CR".
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.9. Other requirements/6.1.9.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Other requirements] - [Reference marks]

children.raw_text: Automatic activation and deactivation of the main-beam headlamps:
The sensor system used to control the automatic activation and deactivation of the main-beam headlamps, as described in paragraph 6.1.7.1., shall comply with the following requirements:
The boundaries of the minimum fields in which the sensor is able to detect light emitted from other vehicles defined in paragraph 6.1.7.1. above are defined by the angles indicated below.

Horizontal angles: 15° to the left and 15° to the right. Vertical angles:
Upward angle 5° Mounting height of the sensor (centre of sensor aperture above the ground) Less than 2 m Between 1.5 m and 2.5 m Greater than 2.0 m Downward angle 2° 2° to 5° 5° These angles are measured from the centre of the sensor aperture relative to a horizontal straight line through its centre and parallel to the longitudinal median plane of the vehicle.

children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Other requirements] - [Automatic activation] - [Sensor system] - [Detection fields] - [Angles specification]

children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.9. Other requirements/6.1.9.3. /6.1.9.3.1. /6.1.9.3.1.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Other requirements] - [Automatic activation] - [Sensor system] - [Detection fields]

children.raw_text:
The sensor system shall be able to detect on a straight level road: (a) An oncoming power driven vehicle at a distance extending to at least
400 m;
(b) A preceding power driven vehicle or a vehicle-trailers combination at a distance extending to at least 100 m;
(c) An oncoming bicycle at a distance extending to at least 75 m, its illumination represented by a white lamp with a luminous intensity of
150 cd with a light emitting area of 10 cm² ± 3 cm² and a height above a ground of 0.8 m.
E/ECE/TRANS/505/Rev.1/Add.47/Rev.12 33
To verify compliance with (a) and (b) above, the oncoming and preceding power driven vehicle (or vehicle-trailer combination) shall have position lamps (if applicable) and dipped-beam headlamps switched ON.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.9. Other requirements/6.1.9.3. /6.1.9.3.1. /6.1.9.3.1.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Other requirements] - [Automatic activation] - [Sensor system] - [Detection distances]

children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Other requirements] - [Automatic activation] - [Sensor system]

children.raw_text: The transition from main-beam to dipped-beam and vice versa according to the conditions indicated in paragraph 6.1.7.1. above may be performed automatically and shall not cause discomfort, distraction or glare.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.9. Other requirements/6.1.9.3. /6.1.9.3.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Other requirements] - [Automatic activation] - [Transition]

children.raw_text: The overall performance of the automatic control shall be verified by:
Means of simulation or other means of verification accepted by the Type Approval Authority , as provided by the applicant.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.9. Other requirements/6.1.9.3. /6.1.9.3.3. /6.1.9.3.3.1.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Other requirements] - [Automatic activation] - [Performance verification] - [Simulation]

children.raw_text: A test drive according to paragraph 1 in Annex 12. The performance of the automatic control shall be documented and checked against the applicant’s description. Any obvious malfunctioning shall be contested (e. g. excessive angular movement or flicker).
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.9. Other requirements/6.1.9.3. /6.1.9.3.3. /6.1.9.3.3.2.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Other requirements] - [Automatic activation] - [Performance verification] - [Test drive]

children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.9. Other requirements/6.1.9.3. /6.1.9.3.3.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Other requirements] - [Automatic activation] - [Performance verification]

children.raw_text:
The control of the main-beam headlamps may be such that the main-beam headlamps are switched ON automatically only when:
(a) No vehicles, as mentioned in paragraph 6.1.7.1. above, are detected within the fields and distances according to paragraphs 6.1.9.3.1.1.
and 6.1.9.3.1.2.; and (b) The detected ambient lighting levels are as prescribed in paragraph 6.1.9.3.5. below.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.9. Other requirements/6.1.9.3. /6.1.9.3.4.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Other requirements] - [Automatic activation] - [Switching conditions]

children.raw_text:
In the case where main-beam headlamps are switched ON automatically, they shall be switched OFF automatically when oncoming or preceding vehicles, as mentioned in paragraph 6.1.7.1. above, are detected within the fields and distances according to paragraphs 6.1.9.3.1.1. and 6.1.9.3.1.2.
Moreover, they shall be switched OFF automatically when the illuminance produced by ambient lighting conditions exceeds 7000 lx.
Compliance with with this requirement shall be demonstrated by the applicant, using simulation or other means of verification accepted by the Type Approval Authority. If necessary the illuminance shall be measured on a horizontal surface, with a cosine corrected sensor on the same height as the mounting position of the sensor on the vehicle. This may be demonstrated by the manufacturer by sufficient documentation or by other means accepted by the Type Approval Authority.
children.full_path: 6. Individual specifications/6.1. Main-beam headlamp (Regulations Nos.98 and 112)/6.1.9. Other requirements/6.1.9.3. /6.1.9.3.5.
children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Other requirements] - [Automatic activation] - [Automatic deactivation]

children.scope: [Lighting and light-signalling devices installation]-[Main-beam headlamp] - [Other requirements] - [Automatic activation]
